III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth and a staff member have an inappropriate relationship.
Staff has sent youth naked pictures. Yesterday (06/21/23), staff
was seen alone in the gym with youth making inappropriate
contact. It is unknown what inappropriate contact occurred. This
same staff member has also had inappropriate contact with
another youth. Staff asked the youth to hold hands, staff has flirted
and rubbed youth’s back. Staff has been suspended pending an
investigation.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
23, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported he enjoys the facility and has no concerns with the staff
that works there. He reported staff are very nice and treats
everyone the same. Youth A was asked about Staff 1 and he
reported she sometimes works at the facility when she picks up
shifts. He reported she has never overstepped her boundaries
with him. Youth A was asked if Staff 1 has ever touched him which
made him feel uncomfortable. He reported that staff has never
physically touched him and that is not allowed at the facility. Youth
A reported Staff 1 has never held his hand or hugged him. When
asked if he had inappropriate pictures of Staff 1, he reported he
only had pictures of Staff 1 and other staff with him at his high
school graduation. Youth A allowed this consultant and MDHHS
Worker to look through his personal cell phone and no
inappropriate pictures were found. Youth A reported he has never
hung out with Staff 1 outside of her working a shift on the unit. He
reported he hangs out with Staff 1 as he does with every other
staff. Youth A reported he does not know why someone would say
these things about him being in a relationship with Staff 1. He
reported that he feels safe at the facility, and he has never seen
any staff be inappropriate with any of the youth.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
23, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported he has concerns about Staff 1. He reported Staff 1 had
2

sent naked photos to another staff at the facility and this staff
accidentally showed it in the car with the youth in the car. Youth B
reported he was not present in the car when this occurred, and he
just heard it from his peers within the home. Youth B did not want
to say what staff had the photo or what other youth told him. He
reported Staff 1 is really close with Youth A and notes they are
always talking to one another. Youth B reported one day he
noticed Youth A had a bite mark on his arm and he was showing it
off. He reported he told Youth A is not cool to show off a mark he
got from a girl and Youth A laughed about it. Youth B reported
when he made that comment, Staff 1 was sitting next to Youth A
and looked ashamed. He reported he does not want to make a big
deal about this or get Youth A in trouble. Youth B reported Staff 1
is just not a good staff and does not have good boundaries. He
reported he has no concerns with any other staff he has worked
with and has not seen any staff be inappropriate with youth at the
facility.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
29, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C
reported he heard from other youth at the facility that Youth A and
Staff 1 are in a relationship. He stated he has heard they went on
dates but did not say who told him this. Youth C reported Staff 1
has put her hand on his shoulder before and he did not like that.
He stated he told Staff 1 to take her hand off of him and she did.
He also reported she has given out her phone number to the
youth at the facility, which is not allowed. Youth C reported he
heard from a friend, (would not provide the name of his friend),
that they saw a naked picture of Staff 1 on a staff member's
phone. He did know who the staff was, and he stated he never
saw that photo.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 29,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. MDHHS Worker
reviewed the allegations with Staff 1. She reported she is not
dating Youth A and has never been in an inappropriate
relationship with him. She reported she works at the shelter
program mostly and that was where Youth A came from before
moving to this facility. Staff 1 reported she has been picking up
shifts there due to staffing needs. She reported when she works at
the facility, Youth A will always come talk to her due to knowing
her from the shelter. She reported she always makes sure she is
in a public place and never alone with him. Staff 1 reported she
has never spent time with Youth A when she is not working and
that she has never sent him an inappropriate photo. She reported
she sent a photo to Staff 6 before and that was just of her new
3

haircut. Staff 1 reported she heard the youth at the facility saw
Staff 6 get a photo of her and they made it a big deal. She
reported the photo was just of her haircut and she was wearing
clothes. Staff 1 reported she has never touched a youth
inappropriately or in a way that is against their policy. She
reported staff need to remain professional with the youth and
never blur the relationship line with them. When asked about
taking Youth C skating she reported he was not a good skater and
used her arm for balance and that was all. When asked if she was
ever confronted about a bite mark on Youth A she reported that
never occurred. Staff 1 reported she has also never given out her
personal information to youth and that includes her cell phone
number. She reported the youth at the facility did get her phone
number from the staff phone and she had to change her phone
number due to the youth contacting her. Staff 1 reported she
informed Supervisor 2.
Staff 2/Complaint Source was interviewed face to face at the
facility on June 23, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS
Worker. Staff 2 reported she picked up Youth B and Youth C from
school. Youth B asked Staff 2 what her thoughts were about Staff
1. Youth B talked about concerns about Staff 1 being too close
with Youth A and being in a relationship. Youth C disclosed when
he fell at the skate park, Staff 1 was trying to hold his hand and he
did not want that to occur. Both Youth B and Youth C disclosed
Youth A had naked pictures of Staff 1 on his cell phone. Staff 2
reported she has not worked with Staff 1 because she has just
been picking up shifts at the facility. She reported Staff 1 has been
working at the shelter program mainly and that was where Youth
A came from. Staff 2 reported she saw Staff 1 at Youth A’s high
school graduation. She reported she has heard rumors Staff 1 is
dating Youth A and this is concerning. Staff 2 explained staff need
to have professional boundaries with the youth and they are not
allowed to have dating relationships with the youth. She explained
it is the job of the staff to form a trusting relationship with the youth
and not to cross boundaries.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
June 23, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 is actually supervised by Supervisor
2 because she is just picking shifts up at this facility due to the
increased number of youth. He reported Staff 1 has picked up
about three to four shifts at the facility in the past four months.
Supervisor 1 reported he has worked with Staff 1 and has not
seen any concerns and she talks with everyone on the unit. He
4

also reported no other staff have brought concerns to him prior to
these allegations about Staff 1.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via phone on June 23,
2023. Supervisor 2 reported she supervises Staff 1 at the shelter
program. She reported she was present when Youth A was at the
shelter program and Staff 1 was working there. Supervisor 2
reported she saw no concerning interactions between Staff 1 and
Youth A and no one has reported concerns to her about that
relationship. She reported the only feedback that has been given
to Staff 1 is to be sterner with the youth because she doesn’t like
to make the youth upset by giving them restrictions when not
following a task. Supervisor 2 reported Staff 1 did report to her
previously that she had to change her cell phone number because
the youth at the facility somehow got her phone number.
Supervisor 2 reported Staff 1 denied ever giving her phone
number to the youth.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
June 29, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor 3 was asked about the youth being able to get Staff 1’s
phone number off of the staff phone. She reported this is possible.
Supervisor 3 reported there is a staff cell phone that has all the
phone numbers of staff and youth saved in it so that staff can
have a main line to contact. The youth sometimes use that phone
to talk to their attorneys in private and they could have gotten the
phone number that way.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 29,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported
that he has heard the boys saying Youth A is hanging out with
Staff 1 outside of the program, but he does not have any concrete
evidence of this occurring. He reported that he did hear about
Staff 1 needing to change her number because there were
concerns of the youth at the facility have her personal number
which is not allowed. He stated he does not know how the youth
got her phone number. He reported that he has not seen any
inappropriate touching or relationship-type behavior with Staff 1
and any of the youth. Staff 3 reported staff need to have
professional boundaries with the youth. He stated staff should also
not be touching the youth, only giving fist pumps.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 29,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported
she has never seen any inappropriate touch occur between Staff 1
and any youth at the facility. She reported she did have some
5

concerns with Staff 1 being very close with Youth A. When asked
to explain that more, Staff 4 reported she did not know Staff 1
knew Youth A before being placed at the facility and they were
always talking on the couch with one another. Staff 4 reported
Youth E has continued to tell people at the facility that Staff 1 and
Youth A are dating and that Youth A has met up with Staff 1
outside of the facility. Staff 4 reported she did not have any
concrete evidence of this occurring. She reported she just has
seen Staff 1 talking with Youth A on the couch a bunch of times
and knows Youth A has a crush on her. She reported she has
never heard of the youth getting Staff 1’s phone number or any of
the youth calling Staff 1’s personal phone. Staff 4 reported staff
are not allowed to share their personal information with the youth
and noted that staff need to set clear boundaries with the youth.
She reported staff need to remain professional and only keep
physical touch as high fives or fist bumps with the youth.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on June 29, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported he heard
rumors from the other youth at the facility that they think Youth A
and Staff 1 are dating. He reported the main youth that is making
these comments is Youth E. Staff 5 reported he personally has not
seen any concerns between Youth A and Staff 1. He reported
Staff 1 and Youth A do have a closer relationship since Staff 1
knew him from the shelter program. Staff 5 reported he has not
heard or seen any inappropriate pictures of Staff 1. Staff 5
reported the staff at the facility all have professional relationships
with the youth, was able to discuss the physical touch policy, and
noted no staff is to share personal information with the youth.
Staff 6 was interviewed via phone July 7, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 6 reported he has
worked with Youth A and Staff 1 prior and has not seen any
concerning boundaries. He reported Staff 1 has a close
relationship with Youth A due to him being at the shelter facility
she works at prior to moving to this facility. Staff 6 reported Youth
A does have a personal crush on Staff 1, but Staff 1 has never
crossed that line. He reported all staff at the facility follow the
policy of having a professional relationship with the youth. When
asked if Staff 1 every sent him photos of herself, he reported she
has sent him a photo to his personal phone. Staff 6 explained
Staff 1 sent a selfie photo of her face asking about her haircut. He
reported she was wearing a black shirt and was not naked. Staff 6
reported he did open the photo when other youth were around at
the facility on accident.
6

Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
29, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Interpreter
was present for translation support for Youth E. Youth E
reported he has no concerns with the relationship the staff has
with the youth at the facility. He noted that it was all professional
relationships. When asked about Youth A and Staff 1, Youth E
reported he has no concerns about that relationship. He stated he
is not very close with Youth A. Youth E denied knowing any
rumors about Youth A and Staff 1. He reported that has not heard
anything about an inappropriate picture.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
23, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Interpreter
was present for translation support for Youth D. Youth D
reported he is a roommate with Youth A. He reported everything is
going well at the facility and the staff treat everyone well. Youth D
reported he has not seen any female staff be inappropriate with
the male youth. He has not heard any rumors either about
someone having inappropriate pictures of a female staff and has
not seen any photos like that. Youth D reported he knows Staff 1
and reported she is a nice staff. He reported has not seen her be
inappropriate with any youth at the facility, including Youth A.
Conference call was held with MDHHS Worker on July 14, 2023.
MDHHS worker reported there are no findings to the investigation.
Documents Reviewed
- Bethany Christian Services Staff Conduct and
Expectations Policy last updated 03/17/22- This policy is
in place for all residential programing Bethany Christian
Services has in place. This policy notes: “Staff are
expected to be positive role models for residents. Staff shall
maintain appropriate boundaries with residents, which
include (but not limited to) to giving residents their personal
contact information, connecting on any platform of social
media, gift giving, or having contact with residents outside
of job responsibilities.”
- Bethany Christian Services Staff Code of Conduct for
Employment in Unaccompanied Children (UAC)
Programs- This policy stated “Staff may not engage in a
romantic or sexual relationship with a UAC while the child is
in ORR care or within three years of the child’s discharge.
- Bethany Christian Services Physical Contact
Guidelines last updated 03/17/22- This policy notes
explains staff boundary’s regarding touch when working
7

with youth in the programing. It notes, “all staff shall
collaborate to teach residents appropriate, healthy touch in
order to promote positive attachments, reduce anxiety, and
increase sense of self-worth.” The policy notes, “the
following types of touch are prohibited: any type of touch,
comment, or gesture that is or could be perceived as
sexual in nature; giving or receiving back-rubs or any other
type of massage.”
- Human Resource (HR) File and Training Log for Staff 1-
Staff 1 has no disciplinary actions noted within her HR file.
Staff 1 is up to date on all required training. Staff 1
completed a therapeutic boundaries training on 03/08/2023
noting what appropriate boundaries are with youth.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with the staff having the ability
to perform duties of the position assigned. There was no evidence
to find Staff 1 and Youth A were in an inappropriate sexual
contact.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
